div.pre: 1252 Asia Minor, southern?, before 1912 Burial: c. 430 B.C. (M) Contents: 32+ AR Athens: 1+ tetradr.; 1 didr. Aegina: 2+ st. Clazomenae: 1 dr. Erythrae: 1 dr. Miletus: 1 ob. Chios: 1 didr. Cnidus: 1 dr. Unc. Carian mint: 1 didr. Lycia: 1 third Citium: 3 st.; 1 tetrob. Idalium: 1 dr. Paphus: 1 st. Salamis: 1 st.; 1 tetrob. Soli?: 1 tetrob. Unc. Cypriote: 3 dr. Sidon: 1 octadr. Tyre: 1 st.; 1 tetrob. Persia: 4 sigloi Cyrene: 1+ tetradr.; 1 hemidr. Disposition: Berlin 16; Hirsch Nov. 14, 1912, nos. 493, 538, 542, 545-7, 551, 560, 573-8, 587, 598 Regling, ZfN 1927, p. 5, note 10 Schlumberger, L'argent grec, p. 8, no. 10 The find place was given as Asia Minor or Egypt. The presence of Persian sigloi made Regling incline toward the former area and he considered it possible that the coins were part of Newell's Cilician hd. (no. 1259 below) but that seems to be of later date
